title: How President Biden's dog, Major, became part of his family
description: Patrick Carroll, executive director of the Delaware Humane Association, shares how the Biden family adopted their dog, Major. Anderson Cooper Full Circle airs Monday, Thursday and Friday at 6p ET this week.

title: New video shows conditions inside Texas border facility
description: New video from inside a border facility in Donna, Texas, shows overcrowded conditions as migrants continue to cross the US-Mexico border.

title: Judge allows defamation lawsuit against Trump to proceed
description: A New York appeals court on Tuesday paved the way for a defamation lawsuit against former President Donald Trump to move forward.

title: Nike sues the maker of Lil Nas X 'Satan Shoes'
description: Nike is suing the art collective behind the Lil Nas X "Satan Shoes" that have sparked a social media backlash.

title: Trump is back online
Legal analyst: Theme of Chauvin's defense is to scapegoat witnesses
description: CNN Senior Legal Analyst Laura Coates examines the defense's strategy for former Minneapolis Police officer Derek Chauvin's murder trial in the death of George Floyd.

title: Analysis: Trump's weird post-presidency
description: "Do you miss me yet?"

title: NATO scrambles jets 10 times to track Russian military planes across Europe
description: NATO scrambled fighter jets 10 times Monday to track and intercept an unusually "rare peak" of Russian bombers and fighters flying over the North Sea, Black Sea and Baltic Sea, according to a NATO official.

title: Watch yet another SpaceX prototype explode
description: See SpaceX's SN11 Starship prototype explode during a test flight in Brownsville, Texas. It's the fourth attempt in a row that's met a fiery end.

title: Nike sues the maker of Lil Nas X 'Satan Shoes' for trademark infringement
K-pop stars BTS share racial discrimination they faced
description: K-pop stars BTS have spoken out about their own experience with racial discrimination in the wake of rising anti-Asian violence in the US.

title: All pregnant people deserve a law like New Zealand's
description: Looking back, I cannot recall the exact time, or even the exact day, that I realized I was miscarrying my very-wanted pregnancy. All I remember is that I was at work, and politely excused myself to the bathroom to discover I was bleeding, which confirmed what the cramps and nausea were already telling me. I made an excuse to go home early and went straight to my OB-GYN, where she gave me an ultrasound, her condolences and sent me on my way.

title: See how tattoo art has changed since the 18th century
description: The practice of inking one's skin has a complex history, and like other forms of art, its own set of cultural traditions and ephemera.

title: Prosecutors correct infamous detail of George Floyd's death at Chauvin trial
description: Former Minneapolis Police officer Derek Chauvin knelt on George Floyd for 9 minutes and 29 seconds, prosecutors said Monday, correcting the 8:46 timing that has become a symbol of police brutality.

title: CDC chief warns of 'impending doom' of potential new US wave
description: New Covid-19 cases, hospitalizations and deaths are beginning to rise in the US again, one of the country's top health leaders said Monday.

title: 'He didn't deserve to die like that': Mother of victim in Mozambique attack
description: The Islamic State's Central Africa Province fighters claimed responsibility for a deadly attack on the town of Palma in northern Mozambique, according to a statement published by ISIS' affiliated media wing, Amaq news agency. Dozens of people have been killed, Omar Saranga, spokesman for the Mozambique Defense and Security Forces, said. CNN's David McKenzie reports.

title: World leaders unite to call for pandemic treaty, saying: 'No one is safe until we are all safe'
description: Global leaders have called for a new treaty to help the world prepare for future pandemics, in a warning against rising vaccine nationalism.

title: Major banks face billions in losses after little-known hedge fund's implosion
description: The names of the key players are different, but the lessons similar. The spectacular implosion of hedge fund Archegos Capital Management, much like the GameStop saga earlier this year, serves as a reminder of the dangers posed by extreme leverage, secret derivatives and rock-bottom interest rates.

title: Syria's president and his wife have recovered from Covid-19
End of an era: Sergio Aguero to leave Manchester City
description: Sergio Aguero will leave Manchester City when his contract expires at the end of the season, the club has announced.

title: Meet the doctor on a quest to get the homeless vaccinated against Covid-19
description: When the British government released its guidance on who should be first in line for the Covid-19 vaccine last year, Dr. Zahid Chauhan was surprised to see that one particularly vulnerable group of his patients had been left off the priority list: The homeless.

title: Thailand pushes back thousands fleeing Myanmar as death toll surpasses 500
description: Thailand has reportedly pushed back more than 2,000 people attempting to flee neighboring Myanmar following a series of air strikes carried out by the ruling junta in the southeast of the country.

title: Supersonic airliner could fly LA to Tokyo in under three hours
description: Right now, a lot of us can't even fly out of our own countries, but if Florida-based planemakers Aerion are to be believed, by the end of the decade we'll be able to jet between Los Angeles and Tokyo in under three hours.

title: Beijing passes new 'patriot' election law for Hong Kong that restricts opposition
description: China's government has passed a new law that will drastically restrict the right of Hong Kongers to stand for election and reshape the city's parliament, further entrenching Beijing's power over the supposedly semi-autonomous territory.

title: WHO draft report gives four possible sources for Covid
When and where America's culture war was won
description: Even at their moments of maximum electoral influence -- the presidencies of Ronald Reagan and George W. Bush, the first years of Donald Trump's turbulent reign -- conservatives often lament that they have won the political battle but lost the culture. They're right. And Los Angeles during the early 1970s was the place and time it happened.

title: Giant ship blocking Suez Canal has been freed
description: The Ever Given container ship has been dislodged and is now floating, after blocking the Suez Canal for almost a week, authorities said Monday.

title: In photos: The Worm Moon around the world
description: This month's full moon will be the year's first supermoon, an astronomical phenomenon where the moon is slightly closer to Earth and therefore appears bigger and brighter in the sky.

title: Smog blankets Nepal as hundreds of wildfires rage nationwide
description: Hundreds of wildfires are burning across Nepal, sending smoke and ash across its cities during one of the worst fire seasons in recent years.

title: Volkswagen America might be changing its name
description: In what seemed to be a shocking goof -- pun absolutely intended -- Volkswagen of America on Monday briefly posted an unfinished press release announcing a plan to change its name to Voltswagen of America.

title: Trump takes mic at a wedding and pushes lies about election
description: Former President Donald Trump gave a speech at a Mar-a-Lago wedding that continued to push lies about the 2020 election.

title: This is how the human heart adapts to space
description: When astronaut Scott Kelly spent nearly a year in space, his heart shrank despite the fact that he worked out six days a week over his 340-day stay, according to a new study.

title: A small plane crash killed one person and knocked out power for more than 1,700 people
description: A pilot died after his single-engine plane crashed in northwest Georgia on Monday night, according to authorities.

title: 76 all-cash offers on one home. The housing madness shows no signs of slowing
description:
• These stocks are set to benefit from a post-Covid travel rebound
• A closed skating rink will be converted into a homeless shelter named after Alex Trebek

title: WHO draft report gives four possible sources for Covid-19
Toxic chemical 'Hall of Shame' calls out major retailers for failing to act
description: A dozen major companies earned an F for failing to publicly address the growing problem of toxic chemicals that may be in the products they sell to consumers, according to the 2021 Who's Minding the Store? A Report Card on Retailer Actions to Eliminate Toxic Chemicals.

title: Analysis: Fears over potential fourth surge rise
description: How Covid-weary Americans behave now will decide how many are yet to die.

title: Federal prosecutors add sex trafficking charges against Ghislaine Maxwell
description: Federal prosecutors filed sex trafficking charges against Ghislaine Maxwell, the former associate of Jeffrey Epstein, alleging she recruited and groomed a 14-year-old girl to engage in sex acts with Epstein as recently as 2004.

title: Why Lindsey Graham says he *has* to have an AR-15
description: In the wake of two (more) high-profile mass shootings, we're (again) talking about guns -- and whether Congress will do anything to restrict people from purchasing them.

title: Canada halting AstraZeneca vaccine shots for 55s and younger
description: Canada's National Advisory Committee on Immunization recommended Monday that the AstraZeneca Covid-19 vaccine should not be used in adults under age 55 while rare cases of serious blood clots following vaccination are being investigated, according to a release from the committee.

title: Highest number of migrant children in border facilities since government started releasing data
description: The number of unaccompanied migrant children in border facilities reached its highest point on Sunday since the federal government began releasing data last week.

title: Bolsonaro replaces six ministers as Covid crisis balloons
description: Brazilian Defense Minister Fernando Azevedo e Silva has resigned from his position in a surprise move.

title: How to visit two of Hong Kong's most remote islands in one day
description: Although some travelers think of Hong Kong as just Hong Kong Island and the Kowloon peninsula, the city is home to hundreds of inhabited and uninhabited islands.

title: Cuba could be on the cutting edge of vaccine research
description: Cuba is the first country in Latin America to develop two Covid-19 vaccine candidates  -- if both succeed the island will be on the cutting edge of vaccine research. CNN's Patrick Oppmann reports.
